About Yasca

Yasca is a multi-platform static analysis tool designed to help developers create high-quality, secure software. More information can be found at yasca.org.

Yasca Version: 3.0.5

The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/dfsms\/dashboard.php","lineNumber":155,"message":"$qurys=mysqli_query($con,\"select sum(tblorders.Quantity*tblproducts.ProductPrice) as tt from tblorders join tblproducts on tblproducts.id=tblorders.ProductId where date(tblorders.InvoiceGenDate)=CURDATE()-1\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"145":"<div class=\"text-center\">","146":"<span class=\"d-block display-4 text-dark mb-5\"><?php echo number_format($row['tt'],2);?><\/span>","147":"<small class=\"d-block\">Last 7 Days Total Sales<\/small>","148":"<\/div>","149":"<\/div>","150":"<\/div>","151":"<\/div>","152":"","153":"<?php","154":"$qurys=mysqli_query($con,\"select sum(tblorders.Quantity*tblproducts.ProductPrice) as tt from tblorders join tblproducts on tblproducts.id=tblorders.ProductId where date(tblorders.InvoiceGenDate)=CURDATE()-1\");","155":"$rw=mysqli_fetch_array($qurys);","156":"?>","157":"<div class=\"col-lg-3 col-md-6\">","158":"<div class=\"card card-sm\">","159":"<div class=\"card-body\">","160":"<div class=\"d-flex justify-content-between mb-5\">","161":"<div>","162":"<span class=\"d-block font-15 text-dark font-weight-500\">Yesterday Sales<\/span>","163":"<\/div>","164":"<div>"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/dfsms\/sales-report-details.php","lineNumber":11,"message":"$query=mysqli_query($con,\"delete from tblcategory where id='$cmpid'\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"1":"session_start();","2":"\/\/error_reporting(0);","3":"include('includes\/config.php');","4":"if (strlen($_SESSION['aid']==0)) {","5":" header('location:logout.php');","6":" } else{","7":"\/\/ Code for deletion ","8":"if(isset($_GET['del'])){ ","9":"$cmpid=substr(base64_decode($_GET['del']),0,-5);","10":"$query=mysqli_query($con,\"delete from tblcategory where id='$cmpid'\");","11":"echo \"<script>alert('Category record deleted.');<\/script>\"; ","12":"echo \"<script>window.location.href='manage-categories.php'<\/script>\";","13":"}","14":"?>","15":"<!DOCTYPE html>","16":"<html lang=\"en\">","17":"<head>","18":" <meta charset=\"UTF-8\" \/>","19":" <meta name=\"viewport\" content=\"width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0, maximum-scale=1.0, user-scalable=no\" \/>","20":" <title>Manage Invoices<\/title>"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. module)try{module.exports=e}catch(t){}}(tN)}();"]},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/dfsms\/view-invoice.php","lineNumber":11,"message":"$query=mysqli_query($con,\"delete from tblcategory where id='$cmpid'\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"1":"session_start();","2":"error_reporting(0);","3":"include('includes\/config.php');","4":"if (strlen($_SESSION['aid']==0)) {","5":" header('location:logout.php');","6":" } else{","7":"\/\/ Code for deletion ","8":"if(isset($_GET['del'])){ ","9":"$cmpid=substr(base64_decode($_GET['del']),0,-5);","10":"$query=mysqli_query($con,\"delete from tblcategory where id='$cmpid'\");","11":"echo \"<script>alert('Category record deleted.');<\/script>\"; ","12":"echo \"<script>window.location.href='manage-categories.php'<\/script>\";","13":"}","14":"?>","15":"<!DOCTYPE html>","16":"<html lang=\"en\">","17":"<head>","18":" <meta charset=\"UTF-8\" \/>","19":" <meta name=\"viewport\" content=\"width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0, maximum-scale=1.0, user-scalable=no\" \/>","20":" <title>Manage Invoices<\/title>"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following for comparison to each other, long term storage (database),\r\nor cache expirations. Instead, use UTC time or an _offset() variant for your platform.\r\n\r\nFrom PHP:\r\n\tIt is not safe to rely on the system's timezone settings. You are *required* to use the\r\n\tdate.timezone setting or the date_default_timezone_set() function. In case you used any of\r\n\tthose methods and you are still getting this warning, you most likely misspelled the timezone identifier.\r\n\tWe selected the timezone 'UTC' for now, but please set date.timezone to select your timezone.\r\n\r\n\r\nTimezone changes on the server or daylight saving time events cause incorrect comparisons between times.\r\nThis is a larger threat than the system UTC time changing for Windows applications because changing the\r\ntime in Windows requires Administrative privileges, whereas changing the timezone does not.\r\n\r\nIf local time is merely displayed to the user, unexpected changes may only annoy users.\r\nIf local time is used for session or credential expiration, this creates an opportunity for other attacks.\r\nIf local time is used for throttling or caching, this creates an opportunity for denial of service events","references":{"https:\/\/cwe.mitre.org\/data\/definitions\/613.html":"CWE-613: Insufficient Session Instead, use UTC time or an _offset() variant for your platform.\r\n\r\nFrom PHP:\r\n\tIt is not safe to rely on the system's timezone settings. You are *required* to use the\r\n\tdate.timezone setting or the date_default_timezone_set() function. In case you used any of\r\n\tthose methods and you are still getting this warning, you most likely misspelled the timezone identifier.\r\n\tWe selected the timezone 'UTC' for now, but please set date.timezone to select your timezone.\r\n\r\n\r\nTimezone changes on the server or daylight saving time events cause incorrect comparisons between times.\r\nThis is a larger threat than the system UTC time changing for Windows applications because changing the\r\ntime in Windows requires Administrative privileges, whereas changing the timezone does not.\r\n\r\nIf local time is merely displayed to the user, unexpected changes may only annoy users.\r\nIf local time is used for session or credential expiration, this creates an opportunity for other attacks.\r\nIf local time is used for throttling or caching, this creates an opportunity for denial of service events","references":{"https:\/\/cwe.mitre.org\/data\/definitions\/613.html":"CWE-613: Insufficient Session
